Source.Name: quakespasm
Source.Summary: A *Nix friendly Quake Engine based on the SDL port of the popular FitzQuake
Source.Description: QuakeSpasm is a modern, cross-platform Quake engine based on FitzQuake It includes support for 64 bit CPUs and custom music playback, a new sound driver, some graphical niceities, and numerous bug-fixes and other improvements. Quakespasm utilizes either the SDL or SDL2 frameworks, so choose which one works best for you. SDL is probably less buggy, but SDL2 has nicer features and smoother mouse input - though no CD support. Game data must be placed in ~/.quakespasm/id1.
